summary: This document is a 2002 ISDA Master Agreement between Deutsche Bank AG and Southern Financial, LLC, outlining the terms and conditions governing financial transactions between the parties. It includes provisions on obligations, events of default, termination events, and tax representations, as well as specific clauses related to the parties' financial responsibilities and rights.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is mentioned as a significant owner of Southern Financial, LLC, with specific conditions regarding his ownership affecting the agreement.

persons.name: Kathleen Yohe
persons.context: Kathleen Yohe is identified as a director of Deutsche Bank AG, signing the agreement on behalf of the bank.

persons.name: Darren K. Indyke
persons.context: Darren K. Indyke is appointed as the process agent for Southern Financial, LLC, responsible for receiving service of process.

persons.name: Cynthia Cuomo
persons.context: Cynthia Cuomo is mentioned in the context of signing the agreement but without a specified role.

events.title: Execution of ISDA Master Agreement
events.description: The ISDA Master Agreement is executed between Deutsche Bank AG and Southern Financial, LLC, establishing the terms for future transactions.

keyFacts: The agreement outlines specific conditions under which Jeffrey Epstein must maintain ownership of Southern Financial, LLC.
Darren K. Indyke is appointed as the process agent for Southern Financial, LLC.
The agreement includes provisions for events of default and termination events that could affect the financial obligations of the parties.
The governing law for the agreement is specified as the laws of the State of New York.
The agreement incorporates provisions from the ISDA 2010 Short Form HIRE Act Protocol.
